text:
Cairano Masterclass, weekend of shows in Sant'Andrea di Conza
01 Nov 2019, 12:28 by Redazione

Where Sant'Andrea di Conza
When From 02/11/2019 to 11/3/2019

Weekend of shows in Sant'Andrea di Conza as part of the Cairano Masterclass. Actors and students move to the premises of the former Furnace. Three events open to the public starting at 9.00 pm, free admission. Events in the event in the sign of the Theater, so Sant'Andrea di Conza makes its debut in the project. It begins on Saturday 2 November with Ernesto Lama, protagonist of "Assolo per Due". With Aniello Palomba on guitar, a journey through the sounds and words of the 1900s. On November 3, Francesco Di Leva returns to the stage with "Muhammad Ali". Directed by Pino Carbone, written by Linda Dalisi. Scenes by Mimmo Palladino, costumes by Ursula Patzak. Music by Marco Messina and Sacha Ricci. On Monday 5 November there is the show "Bugie a parte". With Gian Cro ', Noemi Bordi, Domizia D'Amico. Music by Corrado Cirillo. Written by Gian Cro 'directed by Ario Avecone and Gian Cro'. The Cairano Masterclass, show business school, becomes central in the cultural autumn of Upper Irpinia. On Thursday, October 31, students attended the screening of "The Mayor of the Rione Sanit√†" at the Multiplex Cinema Nuovo of Lioni, with the presence of the director Mario Martone and the leading actor Francesco Di Leva. In the debate organized with the collaboration of Zia Lidia Social Club there was also talk of the extraordinary occasion that the Masterclass is offering to the territory and to young people. The Mayor of Cairano, Luigi D'Angelis, took the floor, recalling the stages of a great challenge.
